name: CrispantCal
tagline: R/Shiny web app to calculate injection mix volumes for CRISPR-Cas9 experiments
body:
### CRISPR-Cas9
CRISPR-Cas9 is a revolutionary new experimental technique for genome editing. For a scientific overview, see [this review](http://www.sciencemag.org/content/346/6213/1258096.full) (also available as a [PDF](http://www.sciencemag.org/content/346/6213/1258096.full.pdf)). For a less technical introduction, you can find a large number of articles and videos on the internet, for example [this article by Wired](http://www.wired.com/2015/07/crispr-dna-editing-2/) or many [videos on YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=crispr+cas9).

### CrispantCal web calculator
This web app calculates optimal injection mix volumes for CRISPR-Cas9 experiments in the lab. It is designed to be easily accessible from a laptop or phone while preparing experiments.

CrispantCal was developed using the [Shiny](http://shiny.rstudio.com/) web application framework for the R programming language, and is hosted online using the [shinyapps.io](https://www.shinyapps.io/) service by [RStudio](https://www.rstudio.com/).

### How to access
The CrispantCal web app can be accessed with a desktop or mobile browser at: [https://lmweber.shinyapps.io/CrispantCal](https://lmweber.shinyapps.io/CrispantCal)

### Local installation
The CrispantCal app can also be installed locally and run from an R session in RStudio with the R command `runGitHub("lmweber/CrispantCal")`. This requires the `shiny` package to be installed and loaded first, which can be done with the commands `install.packages("shiny")` and `library(shiny)`.

If you are not familiar with R, we recommend [RStudio](https://www.rstudio.com/) as a user-friendly editor. You will also need to download R from [CRAN](https://cran.r-project.org/). Introductory tutorials are available from the RStudio website.

Once you have installed R and RStudio, open RStudio and paste the commands above into the Console window, which is on the left or in the bottom left corner of the screen in the default layout. The CrispantCal app should then launch in a new window or in the Viewer pane on the right.

Note that on Mac OSX Yosemite, the `wget` utility may cause errors with the `runGitHub` command. This can be fixed by uninstalling `wget`.

### More information
Instructions on how to use the CrispantCal calculator and details about the calculations are shown in the Information section on the main page of the app.

### Authors
Developed by Lukas M. Weber, Jonas Zaugg, Anastasia Felker, and Christian Mosimann (Mark D. Robinson and Christian Mosimann labs), Institute of Molecular Life Sciences, University of Zurich, Switzerland.
